question: You have learnt about human ______ system and its functions in Chapter 2.
The term reproductive health simply refers to healthy reproductive organs with normal ______.
Reproductive health includes the emotional and ______ aspects of reproduction also.
According to the ______ Health Organisation (WHO), reproductive health means a total well-being in all aspects of reproduction.
Reproductive health means a total well-being in all aspects of reproduction, i.e., physical, emotional, behavioural and ______.
A society with people having physically and functionally normal reproductive organs might be called ______ healthy.
India was amongst the first countries in the world to initiate action plans and programmes at a ______ level.
These programmes called ‘______ planning’ were initiated in 1951.
Improved programmes are currently in operation under the popular name ‘Reproductive and ______ Health Care (RCH) programmes’.
Creating awareness among people about various reproduction related aspects is a major task under these ______.
Providing facilities and support for building up a reproductively healthy society are major tasks under these ______.
